intro: Parosela barbata, commonly known as the hairy parosela, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Parosela barbata is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
